fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • An article (The mattress landfill crisis, 12 February, page 4, G2) said the UK company Circom recycled about 60% of the mattresses it processed. To clarify, Circom recycles 60% of the materials in all of the mattresses it processes, and the remaining 40% is used as fuel. • A feature (Tampon wars, 11 February, page 9, Journal) referred to Unilever’s 2016 buyout of the US shaving business Dollar Shave Club as being “by the Gillette-owning Unilever”. Gillette is owned by Procter & Gamble. • Other recently corrected articles include: How locked-room mystery king Seishi Yokomizo broke into English at last Ministers propose ban on unregulated care homes for children How ultra-processed food took over your shopping basket Giant dams enclosing North Sea could protect millions from rising waters
